page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF HERODSFOOT
page.content: THIS BLOCK ONLY CONTAINS ONE VILLAGE WITH A FEW SCATTERED FARMHOUSES. MUCH OF THE BLOCK IS FOREST OWNED BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION AND KNOWN AS THE KERNOW FOREST.(KERNOW IS CORNISH FOR CORNWALL). THERE IS OTHER WOODLAND IN THE BLOCK, BOTH DECIDUOUS AND CONIFEROUS, OWNED BY LOCAL FARMERS. THE BLOCK IS ALSO CHARACTERISED BY MANY RIVERS, TEN STREAMS COMING TOGETHER TO FORM THE WEST LOOE RIVER. THE LAND IS THEREFORE CUT INTO MANY DEEP VALLEYS, AND ROADS ARE FEW. HERODSFOOT WAS A MINING VILLAGE,WITH TWO MINES,MINING SILVER,LEAD AND TIN. THERE WERE A LOT MORE HOUSES, THREE PUBS, A COFFEE HOUSE AND A MEN'S CLUB. ALL THESE HAVE NOW GONE. MOST LOCAL JOBS ARE IN FORESTRY, FARMING,(CATTLE,SHEEP AND ARABLE), AND TOURISM. THERE IS NO PUBLIC TRANSPORT BUT PEOPLE CAN COMMUTE BY CAR. (CONTD)
